intro: Dorotheanthus oculatus, commonly known as the eye-flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive dark center, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens. Dorotheanthus oculatus is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
